org.jets3t.apps.cockpit
Class LoginDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      org.jets3t.apps.cockpit.LoginDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class LoginDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener

Dialog box for managing AWS Credentials, including storing and retrieving encrypted credentials.

AWS login credentials can be entered manually by the user, or they may be saved/remembered to files encrypted with a password of the user's choosing.

See Also:
Serialized Form

saveLoginFieldsChanged

protected void saveLoginFieldsChanged()
Determines whether sufficient details have been provided for a set of AWS Authorization credentials to be saved/remembered. When sufficient details are available, the Remember button is enabled.

Credentials may only be saved/remembered when the AWS Access Key, AWS Secret Key, and a friendly name has been specified. An encryption password may also be specified but is not required - the default password will be used if none is provided.

getAWSCredentials

protected AWSCredentials getAWSCredentials()
Returns:
the AWS login credentials entered or selected by the user.

showDialog

public static AWSCredentials showDialog(java.awt.Frame owner,
                                        java.io.File preferencesDirectory)
Displays the dialog box and waits until the user enters/selects the AWS login credentials to use, or cancells the dialog.

If the user has entered or selected credentials, these are returned by this method. If the user cancels the dialog, this method returns null.

Parameters:
owner - the Frame within which this dialog will be displayed and centered
preferencesDirectory - the directory where saved/remembered logins are stored as *.enc files.
Returns:
the AWS credentials entered/selected by the user, or null if the dialog was cancelled

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Creates stand-alone dialog box for testing only.

Parameters:
args -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
